results.name: Denominator of 3*(3+(-1)^n) / (n+1)^2.
comment: ( Numerator of (n+1)/2 ) * ( Numerator of (n+1)/3 ). - _Wesley Ivan Hurt_, Jul 18 2014
A divisibility sequence, that is, if n divides m then a(n) divides a(m). - _Peter Bala_, Feb 27 2019
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
P. Bala, A note on the sequence of numerators of a rational function
Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (0,0,0,0,0,3,0,0,0,0,0,-3,0,0,0,0, 0,1).
formula: The following remarks assume an offset of 1.
a(n) = n^2/b(n), where b(n) is the purely periodic sequence [1,2,3,2,1,6,...] with period 6. Thus a(n) is a quasi-polynomial in n:
O.g.f.: F(x) - 2*F(x^2) - 6*F(x^3) + 12*F(x^6), where F(x) = x*(1 + x)/(1 - x)^3 is the generating function for the squares. (End)
results.author: _Paul Barry_, Apr 03 2007
